channel.title: Need help with Unity3D
channel.description:
Okay, well I'm making a Unity project (Racing) and I want to put a Pre-Made car in it. Like a nice car. How do I do it?
(Yeah, prolly a noob question but I'm not to smart >. <.........

item.title: Need help with Unity3D
item.dc:creator: @bibbobbib bibbobbib
item.description:
@bibbobbib wrote:

[quote=“ictbguud, post:3, topic:456541”]I know how to import car models in now but I can’t really find ANY tutorial on how to make it move.

I think I got the codes to make it move:

using UnityEngine;
using System.Collections;

public class EffectController : MonoBehaviour
{
public Generate2DReflection generate2dReflection;
public GlowEffectThreshold_26 glowEffect;
public MotionBlurEdge motionBlur;
public ColorCorrectionEffect colorCorrection;

void Update()
{
	if(QualitySettings.currentLevel < QualityLevel.Good)
	{
		if (generate2dReflection)
			generate2dReflection.enabled = false;
		if (glowEffect)
			glowEffect.enabled = false;
		if (motionBlur)	
			motionBlur.enabled = false;
		if (colorCorrection)
			colorCorrection.enabled = false;
	}
	else
	{
		if (generate2dReflection)
			generate2dReflection.enabled = true;
		if (glowEffect)
			glowEffect.enabled = true;
		if (motionBlur)
			motionBlur.enabled = true;
		if (colorCorrection)
			colorCorrection.enabled = true;
	}
}

}

I don’t know if this is how to make it move. >. <[/quote]

That is entirely wrong, that is the code for specular reflection and motion blur and something else. I think just image effects.

On topic : try checking this, it will contain lots of useful scripts for a car game.

Unity

Unity - Learn - Resources - Downloads

Unity is the ultimate game development platform. Use Unity to build high-quality 3D and 2D games, deploy them across mobile, desktop, VR/AR, consoles or the Web, and connect with loyal and enthusiastic players and customers.


If you need I do have a car controller and other scripts to do with a car for example traction controll and anti roll. to make these scripts work you will need to add a rigidbody to your car by going to component>physics>rigidbody. If you need any help feel free to PM me.

If you are just talking about adding your model to the scene then just get it the correct format and drag it across from windows explorer or finder. Main formats are .fbx .obj .3ds .max (requires you have 3ds max on your computer).

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with Unity3D
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

That’s not at all right. Do you see anything there that changes the model’s position? Because I don’t. It’s actually a bunch of useless code as it contains fields assigned and never used.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with Unity3D
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

You “think” you have the right code. Which probably means you just took it off some post or some tutorial and don’t understand it at all. Don’t just immediately start going to the game part, take time to learn how to code or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with Unity3D
item.dc:creator: @ictbguud ictbguud
item.description:
@ictbguud wrote:

I know how to import car models in now but I can’t really find ANY tutorial on how to make it move.

I think I got the codes to make it move:

using UnityEngine;
using System.Collections;

public class EffectController : MonoBehaviour
{
public Generate2DReflection generate2dReflection;
public GlowEffectThreshold_26 glowEffect;
public MotionBlurEdge motionBlur;
public ColorCorrectionEffect colorCorrection;

void Update()
{
	if(QualitySettings.currentLevel < QualityLevel.Good)
	{
		if (generate2dReflection)
			generate2dReflection.enabled = false;
		if (glowEffect)
			glowEffect.enabled = false;
		if (motionBlur)	
			motionBlur.enabled = false;
		if (colorCorrection)
			colorCorrection.enabled = false;
	}
	else
	{
		if (generate2dReflection)
			generate2dReflection.enabled = true;
		if (glowEffect)
			glowEffect.enabled = true;
		if (motionBlur)
			motionBlur.enabled = true;
		if (colorCorrection)
			colorCorrection.enabled = true;
	}
}

}

I don’t know if this is how to make it move. >. <

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with Unity3D
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Wrong section. You should put this in the general programming board or the game development forums.

Well, you should probably read up on some 3D documentation first, because you clearly (maybe you do, but it just sounds like you don’t) don’t know how to display 3D shapes - aka models. You need to find a car model and then read on importing models into Unity3D (or whatever the software is). However, if you can’t do this much on your own, don’t get expect to go far and even get the car moving. You will fail. Practice with other stuff first, like maybe even a 2D game or just general programming if needed.

Read full topic
